WHO CAN DONATE BLOOD?


Blood can be donated by anyone who is healthy:
 • Age: from 18 to 65 years old
 • Body weight: above 55 kg, proportional to its weight
 • Body temperature: not above 37 °C
 • Blood pressure: systolic 100 to 180 mm Hg, diastolic 60 to 110 mm Hg
 • Puls: 50 to 100 beats per minute



WHO IS NOT ALLOWED TO DONATE BLOOD?

 Some blood donors are permanently rejected because they can be infected and can be a great risk:
 • alcohol and drug addicts
 • men that have had sexual relationships with other men
 • women and men that have had sexual relationships witch a prostitues
 • people that are very often changing their sexual partners
 • people that have been taking drugs via needles
 • people that have been treated from STD-s
 • people that are HIV-positive
 • sexual partners of all above listed people



HOW LONG WILL IT TAKE TO REPLENISH THE PINT OF BLOOD I DONATE?

 The plasma from your donation is replaced within about 24 hours. Red cells need about four to six weeks for complete replacement. That’s why at least eight weeks are required between whole blood donations.



DOES THE RED CROSS PAY BLOOD DONORS?

 No. All Red Cross blood donors are volunteers. In fact, all blood collected for transfusion must be from volunteer donors.



BEFORE YOUR DONATION

 • Maintain a healthy iron level in your diet by eating iron rich foods, such as red meat, fish, poultry, beans, spinach, iron-fortified cereals and raisins.
 • Get a good night sleep.
 • Drink an extra 16 oz. of water or nonalcoholic fluids before the donation.
 • Eat a healthy meal before your donation. Avoid fatty foods, such as hamburgers, fries or ice cream before donating. (Fatty foods can affect the tests we do on your blood. If there is too much fat in your blood, your donation cannot be tested for infectious diseases and the blood will not be used for transfusion.)



AFTER YOUR DONATION

 • Take the time to enjoy a snack and a drink in the refreshments area immediately after donating.
 • rink an extra four (8 ounce) glasses of liquids and avoid alcohol over the next 24 hours.
 • Remove the wrap bandage (if you had one put on your arm) within the next hour.

Blood4You is an Android Application which helps blood donors to track blood donating events around the city. It reminds the user when the blood donating cooldown is over and when he is ready to donate blood again. Application stores information about blood donations that took place in the past and shows them to the user. Application uses push notifications and shows the location of the next blood donating event. User can share and update his blood donating status via social networks and invite his friends to take part in those activites too.
